name: literately
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows that you are able to read and write and can express yourself clearly in written form: These journalists are civilized and intelligent analysts who literately express their expert opinions on world affairs. Some of the bilingual children were literately proficient, but not orally proficient.
More examplesFewer examplesShe claims that people no longer express themselves literately these days.The composer's idea is essentially aural, and not therefore literately defined.These young people are unable to function literately, even after years of schooling.
